intro: Adenia fruticosa, commonly known as the rock fig, is a woody shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Randiaceae and is characterized by its dense, thorny stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers followed by edible, fleshy fruits that are often consumed by wildlife. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Adenia fruticosa is also valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional medicinal uses.
